  • Constructor Details

    • Model

      public Model(int dimension)
      Constructs a Model object with the specified dimension. Initializes the game boards, ships, and random generator.
      Parameters:
      dimension - The dimension of the game board.

    • Model

      public Model(int dimension, GraphicalInterface window)
      Constructs a Model object with the specified dimension and graphical interface. Initializes the game boards, ships, random generator, and graphical interface.
      Parameters:
      dimension - The dimension of the game board.
      window - The graphical interface associated with the model.

  • Method Details

    • getScore

      public double getScore()
      Retrieves the score of the computer player. The score is calculated based on the number of hits on the player's ships
      Returns:
      The score of the computer player.

    • getReadyToPlay

      public boolean getReadyToPlay()
      Getter when user press Play button.
      Returns:
      boolean

    • setReadyToPlay

      public void setReadyToPlay(boolean readyToPlay)
      Setter when user press play button.
      Parameters:
      readyToPlay - boolean for readyToPlay.

    • placeShips

      public boolean placeShips(int x, int y, int length, boolean vertical)
      This method will execute when user press design and they want to place the ships manually.
      Parameters:
      x - row of the board.
      y - column of the board.
      length - length of the ships.
      vertical - Vertical position of the ships.
      Returns:
      space to place the ship.

    • getPlaying

      public boolean getPlaying()
      Retrieves the playing status of the game.
      Returns:
      true if the game is currently being played, false otherwise.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game by setting the playing status to true.

    • stopGame

      public void stopGame()
      Stops the game by setting the playing status to false.

    • computerMove

      public int[] computerMove()
      Generates a random move for the computer player.
      Returns:
      An array of size 2 containing the x-coordinate and y-coordinate of the computer's move.

    • computerMakesMove

      public void computerMakesMove()
      Executes the computer's move by selecting the specified position on the player's board.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the selected position.
      y - The y-coordinate of the selected position.

    • getTotalShips

      public int getTotalShips()
      Retrieves the total number of ships in the game.
      Returns:
      The total number of ships.

    • getComputerShipsHit

      public int getComputerShipsHit()
      Retrieves the number of hits on the computer's ships by the player.
      Returns:
      The number of hits on the computer's ships.

    • getPlayerShipsHit

      public int getPlayerShipsHit()
      Retrieves the number of hits on the player's ships by the computer.
      Returns:
      The number of hits on the player's ships.

    • randomPlayerBoard

      public void randomPlayerBoard()
      Generates a random player board by placing ships randomly on the game board.

    • initializeBoard

      public void initializeBoard(char[][] b)
      Initializes the specified board with empty spaces.
      Parameters:
      b - The board to be initialized.

    • copyBoard

      public void copyBoard(char[][] b, char[][] c)
      Copies the contents of one board to another.
      Parameters:
      b - The destination board.
      c - The source board.

    • saveBoard

      public void saveBoard(char[][] b, PrintWriter printWriter)
      Saves the specified board to a PrintWriter.
      Parameters:
      b - The board to be saved.
      printWriter - The PrintWriter to write the board to.

    • loadBoard

      public void loadBoard(Scanner scanner)
      Loads the game board from the specified Scanner object.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The Scanner object used to read the game board.

    • newGame

      public void newGame(int dimension)
      Starts a new game with the specified dimension.
      Parameters:
      dimension - The dimension of the game board.

    • savePlayerBoard

      public void savePlayerBoard(PrintWriter printWriter)
      Saves the player's board to the specified PrintWriter.
      Parameters:
      printWriter - The PrintWriter to write the player's board to.

    • selectComputer

      public int selectComputer(int x, int y)
      Executes a move on the computer's board at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the selected position.
      y - The y-coordinate of the selected position.
      Returns:
      The result of the move: 0 for a miss, 1 for a hit, 2 for a repeated move.

    • selectPlayer

      public int selectPlayer(int x, int y)
      Executes a move on the player's board at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the selected position.
      y - The y-coordinate of the selected position.
      Returns:
      The result of the move: 0 for a miss, 1 for a hit, 2 for a repeated move.

    • select

      public int select(char[][] b, int x, int y)
      Executes a move on the specified board at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      b - The board on which to execute the move.
      x - The x-coordinate of the selected position.
      y - The y-coordinate of the selected position.
      Returns:
      The result of the move: 0 for a miss, 1 for a hit, 2 for a repeated move.

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard(char[][] b)
      Prints the specified board.
      Parameters:
      b - The board to print.

      public char[][] getComputerBoard()
      Retrieves the computer's game board.
      Returns:

      Returns:

      Retrieves the player's game board.
      Returns:
      The player's game board.

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method for testing the Model class.
      Parameters:
      args - The command-line arguments.

    • getDesign

      public boolean getDesign()
      Retrieves the flag indicating if the game is in design mode.
      Returns:
      true if the game is in design mode, false otherwise.

    • setDesign

      public void setDesign(boolean design)
      Sets the design mode flag.
      Parameters:
      design - The value to set for the design mode flag.

    • incrementSecond

      public void incrementSecond()
      Increments the number of seconds. This method is used to track the game duration.

    • getSecond

      public int getSecond()
      Retrieves the number of seconds elapsed in the game.
      Returns:
      The number of seconds elapsed.
